question: If $f(x) = |3x - 1|,$ compute all values of $x$ for which $f(f(x)) = x.$  Enter all the solutions, separated by commas.
answer:
The equation $f(f(x)) = x$ turns into
\[\Big| 3 |3x - 1| - 1 \Big| = x.\]This equation implies $3|3x - 1| - 1 = x$ or $3|3x - 1| - 1 = -x.$

Case 1: $3|3x - 1| - 1 = x.$

If $x \ge \frac{1}{3},$ then $|3x - 1| = 3x - 1,$ so
\[3(3x - 1) - 1 = x.\]The solution to this equation is $x = \frac{1}{2}.$

If $x< \frac{1}{3},$ then $|3x - 1| = 1 - 3x,$ so
\[3(1 - 3x) - 1 = x.\]The solution to this equation is $x = \frac{1}{5}.$

Case 2: $3|3x - 1| - 1 = -x.$

If $x \ge \frac{1}{3},$ then $|3x - 1| = 3x - 1,$ so
\[3(3x - 1) - 1 = -x.\]The solution to this equation is $x = \frac{2}{5}.$

If $x< \frac{1}{3},$ then $|3x - 1| = 1 - 3x,$ so
\[3(1 - 3x) - 1 = -x.\]The solution to this equation is $x = \frac{1}{4}.$

We can check that $\boxed{\frac{1}{5}, \frac{1}{4}, \frac{2}{5}, \frac{1}{2}}$ all satisfy the given equation.
agents_response:
First we should split up the function $f(f(x))$ depending on the range of $x$, because the absolute value makes a difference in this case.

Case 1: $x \leq {1 \over 3}$. In this case, $3x - 1 \leq 0$ so $f(x) = 1 - 3x$, and $f(f(x)) = f(1 - 3x) = |3 - 9x|$.
So $|3 - 9x| = x$.
If $3 - 9x \geq 0 \rightarrow x \leq {1 \over 3}$ then $3 - 9x = x \rightarrow x = {3 \over 10}$.
But $x = {3 \over 10}$ is not in the range $x \leq {1 \over 3}$ so it is not valid.
If $3 - 9x < 0 \rightarrow x > {1 \over 3}$ then $9x - 3 = x \rightarrow x = {3 \over 8}$.
Again, $x = {3 \over 8}$ is not in the range $x \leq {1 \over 3}$ so it is not valid.

Case 2: $x > {1 \over 3}$. In this case, $3x - 1 > 0$ so $f(x) = 3x - 1$, and $f(f(x)) = f(3x - 1) = |9x - 3 - 1| = |9x - 4|$.
So $|9x - 4| = x$.
If $9x - 4 \geq 0 \rightarrow x \geq {4 \over 9}$ then $9x - 4 = x \rightarrow x = {4 \over 8} = {1 \over 2}$, which is in the valid range.
If $9x - 4 < 0 \rightarrow x < {4 \over 9}$ then $4 - 9x = x \rightarrow x = {4 \over 10} = {2 \over 5}$, which is also in the valid range of $x > {1 \over 3}$.

So the solutions are $x = {1 \over 2}$ and ${2 \over 5}$. Hence the final answer is \boxed{{1 \over 2}, {2 \over 5}}.
